data.name: Text editor feature!
data.description:
Imagine you are requested to add a new feature into Brackets software. Given a .txt the feature must be able to separate in a new .txt all the non repeated words (Sensitive Case). The .txt can be full of weird characters.
In order to make it "easier" create a function, which allows that feature, and return a String array given by parameter a string ```function words(givenTxt) {  }```

Also, you MUST add information to the user, adding on ```result[result.length]``` how many valid words were found before the method separeAllWords erased the repeated words, and the difference between them (diff = words before(WB) - words now(WN)) 


Some examples:
```
var text = "Hello bud Bud, hello";
var result = separateAllWords(text);
console.log(result);
//result array would be
Hello
bud
Bud
hello
WB: 4, WN: 4, diff=0

text="hello, (police)kata   kata Kata"
result = separateAllWords(text);
console.log(result);
//result array
hello
police
kata
Kata
WB: 5, WN: 4, diff=1

text="   -->  hello u, (police)) how hOw!! make it noww... see u !!x3"
result = separateAllWords(text);
console.log(result);
//result array
hello
u
police
how
hOw
make
it
noww
see
x3
WB: 11, WN: 10, diff=1
```

WARNING: its considered a valid word every set of characters [a-zA-Z0-9]+ non separated by a not valid character(eg , . - ^ & / spaces etc). If its a not valid character thats a new word.
This is a valid word: 54hgY7. 
This is not a valid word: 85/65j (composed by two valid words: 85 and 65j)

For more information visit http://regexr.com/, type on jTextField: [a-zA-Z0-9]+ and you would see given a text what is considered a valid word. In this example: words before(WB)=109, words now(WN) = 85, the difference = 109-85=24.

Do not forget: CANNOT USE UNDER ANY CIRCUMSTANCE REGULAR EXPRESSIONS, that involves not using split(), replace()... methods
